intro: Cupania laxiflora, commonly known as the laxiflorous cupania, is a flowering plant species native to South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, greenish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in undergrowth of humid forests. Cupania laxiflora is notable for its ecological role in supporting local insect and bird populations.
